name: MockClient
comment: A mock HTTP client designed for use when testing code that uses http/http-testing.BaseClient. This client allows you to define a handler callback for all requests that are made through it so that you can mock a server without having to send real HTTP requests.

constructors.comment: Creates a http/http-testing.MockClient with a handler that receives http/request.Requests and sends http/response.Responses.

streaming.name: streaming
streaming.comment: Creates a http/http-testing.MockClient with a handler that receives StreamedRequests and sends http/streamed_response.StreamedResponses.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides http/http-testing.MockClient.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and http/http-testing.MockClient.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the http/http-testing.MockClient.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

close.name: close
close.comment: Closes the client and cleans up any resources associated with it. It's important to close each client when it's done being used; failing to do so can cause the Dart process to hang.

delete.name: delete
delete.comment:
Sends an HTTP DELETE request with the given headers to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String.

For more fine-grained control over the request, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send instead.

get.name: get
get.comment:
Sends an HTTP GET request with the given headers to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String.

For more fine-grained control over the request, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send instead.

head.name: head
head.comment:
Sends an HTTP HEAD request with the given headers to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String.

For more fine-grained control over the request, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send instead.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
http/http-testing.MockClient.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to http/http-testing.MockClient.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If http/http-testing.MockClient.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of http/http-testing.MockClient.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

post.name: post
post.comment:
Sends an HTTP POST request with the given headers and body to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String.

http/http-testing.MockClient.post.body sets the body of the request. It can be a dart-core.String, a dart-core<dart-core> or a dart-core<dart-core, dart-core>. If it's a String, it's encoded using http/http-testing.MockClient.post.encoding and used as the body of the request. The content-type of the request will default to "text/plain".

If http/http-testing.MockClient.post.body is a List, it's used as a list of bytes for the body of the request.

If http/http-testing.MockClient.post.body is a Map, it's encoded as form fields using http/http-testing.MockClient.post.encoding. The content-type of the request will be set to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"; this cannot be overridden.

http/http-testing.MockClient.post.encoding defaults to UTF-8.

For more fine-grained control over the request, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send instead.

put.name: put
put.comment:
Sends an HTTP PUT request with the given headers and body to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String.

http/http-testing.MockClient.put.body sets the body of the request. It can be a dart-core.String, a dart-core<dart-core> or a dart-core<dart-core, dart-core>. If it's a String, it's encoded using http/http-testing.MockClient.put.encoding and used as the body of the request. The content-type of the request will default to "text/plain".

If http/http-testing.MockClient.put.body is a List, it's used as a list of bytes for the body of the request.

If http/http-testing.MockClient.put.body is a Map, it's encoded as form fields using http/http-testing.MockClient.put.encoding. The content-type of the request will be set to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"; this cannot be overridden.

http/http-testing.MockClient.put.encoding defaults to UTF-8.

For more fine-grained control over the request, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send instead.

read.name: read
read.comment:
Sends an HTTP GET request with the given headers to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String, and returns a Future that completes to the body of the response as a String.

The Future will emit an http/dart-io.HttpException if the response doesn't have a success status code.

For more fine-grained control over the request and response, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send or http/http-testing.MockClient.get instead.

readBytes.name: readBytes
readBytes.comment:
Sends an HTTP GET request with the given headers to the given URL, which can be a dart-core.Uri or a dart-core.String, and returns a Future that completes to the body of the response as a list of bytes.

The Future will emit an http/dart-io.HttpException if the response doesn't have a success status code.

For more fine-grained control over the request and response, use http/http-testing.MockClient.send or http/http-testing.MockClient.get instead.

send.name: send
send.comment:
Sends an HTTP request and asynchronously returns the response.

Implementers should call http/base_request.BaseRequest.finalize to get the body of the request as a http/byte_stream.ByteStream. They shouldn't make any assumptions about the state of the stream; it could have data written to it asynchronously at a later point, or it could already be closed when it's returned.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
